intro: Tovomita stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tovomita, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the island's unique ecosystems. Tovomita stenantha is of interest to botanists due to its distinct morphology and endemic status.
